== Who I Am ==
My name is Magali and I joined the kernel team in February 2023. My main activities revolve around FIPS kernels, which means developing, testing, fixing bugs and preparing these kernels for each SRU cycle.

I received my Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science from the University of SÃ£o Paulo in 2022. That was where I got interested in the Linux kernel and open source as a whole.

== My Ubuntu Story ==
In 2019, my first year of college, I took part in a convert-freshmen-to-use-linux ritual. Ubuntu 18.04 was the chosen Linux distribution to have on my laptop. That really made a difference: Ubuntu was easy to use and it actually made my (very) low-budget computer stop crashing so frequently. I could, then, not only do my university assignments but also any other task painlessly.

=== My Involvement ===
I have been working on preparing FIPS (and sometimes other) kernel packages for SRU (and security) cycles, backporting CVEs, developing new kernels and reporting and fixing bugs found along the way.
